docs.lead_paragraph: For young Americans with no health insurance, Thursday was an important day: those younger than 26 were able to join their parents' plans under the recently enacted health care overhaul. (Previously, children were dropped from their parents' policies at 19, or 23 if they were full-time students.) Young people make up the largest group of uninsured Americans, although they are healthier and cheaper to insure. And they are much less likely to vote.Still, in many states with high rates of uninsured young adults, providing health coverage is not at the forefront of political campaigns. Below, the areas of the country with high rates of uninsured, and how health care is playing out as an issue in those areas: RACES IN STATES WITH HIGH RATES OF UNINSURED YOUNG ADULTS
docs.abstract: The Caucus column notes the kicking in of health care reform measure allowing young adults aged 26 and under to stay on their parents' health insurance plans; map (M)
docs.snippet: For young Americans with no health insurance, Thursday was an important day: those younger than 26 were able to join their parents' plans under the recently enacted health care overhaul. (Previously, children were dropped from their parents' policies...

docs.lead_paragraph: The legal doctrine of "standing," as in standing to sue, doesn't usually get people's juices flowing - even people like newspaper editors who (take my word for this) tend to regard the topic as dry and technical, more suitable for courthouse geeks than general readers.
docs.abstract: Rules about who has the right to bring lawsuits promise to become a hot legal topic in cases involving health care reform and stem cell research.
docs.snippet: Rules about who has the right to bring lawsuits promise to become a hot legal topic in cases involving health care reform and stem cell research.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday Marco Arment, the chief technology officer at the social networking site Tumblr, announced that he would be leaving it to tend to a personal project: Instapaper.

headline.main: Instapaper Goes From Hobby to Start-Up

docs.abstract: Marco Arment, the chief technology officer at the social networking site Tumblr, explains why he's leaving the Web site to tend to Instapaper, a pet project that quickly became profitable.

docs.lead_paragraph: My article in today's paper looked at an interesting situation in the latest edition of The New England Journal of Medicine, one that highlighted the debate in American medicine about whether health care providers should pay for expensive treatments that make relatively small improvements?

headline.main: A Challenge to a Vein Study

docs.abstract: An editorial in the same edition of The New England Journal of Medicine challenges a study.
docs.snippet: An editorial in the same edition of The New England Journal of Medicine challenges a study.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's health insurers are beginning to feel the impact of the new federal health care law, a sweeping overhaul of their business that marked its six-month anniversary on Thursday. They say they are scrambling to comply with the first major wave of new rules, which include starting to cover all children, even the seriously ill, and to provide free preventive care.

headline.main: A Day of Reckoning for Insurers

docs.abstract: Health insurers in the United States are beginning to feel the impact of the new federal health care law.
docs.snippet: Health insurers in the United States are beginning to feel the impact of the new federal health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Midway through my first pregnancy, I was told that I needed an injection that is standard for an uncomplicated pregnancy. I assumed it would be simple to get approval from my insurance company.

headline.main: Quality Health Care? Ask Your Veterinarian

docs.abstract: There's a lot we can learn from animals in many facets of life -- including health care reform.
docs.snippet: There's a lot we can learn from animals in many facets of life -- including health care reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: The article currently topping The New York Times hit parade (otherwise known as the most e-mailed list) is about new research suggesting that even a single session of massage can cause positive biological changes.

headline.main: Pay for Massages With a Flexible Spending Account

docs.abstract: Massages could be available at a significant discount for those who have health care flexible spending accounts through their employer.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama will devote his day to foreign policy, even as the White House struggles to demonstrate that jobs and the economy are Democrats' top priorities.

headline.main: The Early Word: The Case for Peace
